intro: Acmispon nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada burclover, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a low-growing annual or biennial plant that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and the plant has a hairy stem. Acmispon nevadensis thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
